news_header: A study found that cheaper clothes can be more durable than expensive ones, challenging the belief that higher price equals better quality.
news_text: Research from the University of Leeds in collaboration with Primark revealed that cheaper clothing items, such as a £15 pair of women's jeans, outperformed more expensive counterparts in durability tests. The study assessed 65 products, showing no correlation between price and durability. Primark aims to use these findings to improve customer value and has introduced a Durability Framework to ensure longevity in their clothing, regardless of price. The research team plans to continue studying factors affecting garment durability.
